results.title: Crusades: 1095-1291
results.brief_description: Discusses the social, economic and religious climate that gave birth and then momentum to the Crusades and treats the various Crusades from a human viewpoint.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Bert Christensen and Danish Heart Foundation
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.

results.title: Cross country runner
results.creator_credit: Mark McCarty and Department of Theatre Arts, University of California
results.brief_description: A light-hearted allegorical spoof of modern society, depicting the trials and tribulations of a cross-country runner who takes time out from a race to visit friends and family. Cast includes David Aldrich.

results.title: Critical incidents and trauma: response and recovery (for staff)
results.creator_credit: Simon Barnett and Harcroft Consulting Group
results.brief_description: A video training package (with facilitator’s manual) designed to inform employees who may be exposed to critical events in the course of their work. A critical incident is a traumatic event or situation, such as an attack, accident or natural disaster that could have long-term negative effects on those involved. This training package, specifically aimed at staff, provides an understanding of critical incidents, their effects, strategies to promote personal recovery, as well as an overview of responses and interventions used by a broad range of organisations. See also ‘Critical incidents and trauma: promoting recovery through effective management (for managers)’ (310862).

results.title: Crimes of carelessness
results.brief_description: Depicts the appalling loss of life and property which results from preventable fires. The principle unsafe practices which cause fires are illustrated - then safe ways of doing the same things are shown.

results.title: Crime on the streets
results.brief_description: This film recounts the high occurence of street crimes, including theft, burglary, assault and rape. Shows how the behaviour of victim often encourages criminals. Suggests ways of protecting the individuals as well as his/her property from attack. Featuring an interview with Chuck Norris.

results.title: Crete: the island in history. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The relation of Crete to trade routes and centres of the ancient world is considered. The history of Crete is briefly traced, indicating the various empires which at times have occupied the island. These include: the Macedonian empire, the Roman empire, the Byzantine empire, the Saracens, the Venetians, the Ottoman empire, Greece and the German military occupation.
